> Any update?

No update .I've been a little busy lately.

We should add `Text Widget` like the Satellite dashboard.

> FaaS (Function-as-a-Service) is a type of cloud-computing service that allows you to execute code in response to events without the complex infrastructure typically associated with building and launching microservices applications.
OpenFunction as a FaaS platform, provides out-of-box observability with SkyWalking integration.

And link this to the OpenFunction document.
And you should set the legend for service topology. Take a look at the general topology to refer.
@mrproliu I think we at least require a minimal version. We faced NodeJS agent incompatibility in testing today.

@wu-sheng @wankai123 @FeynmanZhou plase review :)

Two things to note:
1. Update document, add a new matric to document which native agent support transport protocol to the satellite. 
2. Update the Satellite, let it could support transport compat protocol from the agent.
I think this document belongs to the Satellite project? And for supporting more versions, we need another release?

> I think this document belongs to the Satellite project? 

Sure, I would add it into the Satellite project.

> And for supporting more versions, we need another release?

Yes, we need to do two thing:
1. Support HTTP message receiver for Nginx, Browser, etc.
2. Support Compat protocol for the oldest agent version.
Closed, add it into the satellite project.
Maybe you are not using UTF-8? Header injection is important, and UTF-8 is the default charset in the whole SkyWalking ecosystem.

> 1. Support HTTP message receiver for Nginx, Browser, etc.

Do we need this? Satellite is for load balancing gRPC traffic, and http protocol uses a different port so why users will connect to Satellite if they are using http protocol?
For now, I would say not, our special HPA/load-balance mechanism is caused by gRPC streaming and connection management mechanism. In HTTP, it is not an issue.
Sure, I just think we could unify the traffic entrance. Then we could do more things, like sampling, data pre-aggregated, etc.

Yes, only we pass the POC pre-aggregation, and could prove pre-aggregation really makes sense. Right now, I think we will not work on that in short term, more works on BanyanDB seem important. One step at a time.
Please assign this plugin development to me, thanks！
Assigned. Good luck.

Move the cold writing to 

> > Due to the downSampling in the OAP server side, we have to support writing data to a block older than the current open ones.
> > For example, we start the banyandb server at "2022-01-27T01:40:20Z", the oldest block may start from "2022-01-27T01:40:20Z" while the OAP server would send stream entities with timestamp "2022-01-27T01:00:00Z" due to the downSampling at hour level.

I tend to introduce some codes to handle errors gracefully

- `InvalidArgument`. This means the client input fails validation.
- `NotFound`. This denotes a resource that is not found.
- `AlreadyExists`: This indicates the resource already exists for creating one.

No update.
Could you update the new entity design and describe logic here?

The service label is used to aggregate all of the labels from the process to the service level. Then, we could do profiling with some similar process from the service level. So we need the `process_service_label` to record them. 
For now, I flat all the labels to the multiple records, in this way, we don't need to worry about the limit of labels count.

So, we have 
1. ProcessTraffic with JSON-ed labels
2. ProcessServiceLabel is service's all labels

Then, when a task is created, all processes are read out and filtered in the memory?

> Then, when a task is created, all processes are read out and filtered in the memory?

Yes. When a task is created, the OAP side read all the processes from the rover side and matches the same labels between process and task. 
Here is the filter logical: https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/8840/files#diff-d2a3c28709c4f0350cd39a3c53bc401b7a5e7f1c73d4f08a6a2457529c28010fR105-R132

New component ID and new Logo changes should be landed here.

> BanyanDB identifies unique data points by their metadata(name and group), entity id, and timestamp. For points with the same of them, the database server uses the new value to override the old one.

This is what we expect, and trace segment ID would be duplicated. What is the issue about exactly?

> The possible solution is the influxdb module: https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/oap-server/server-storage-plugin/storage-influxdb-plugin/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/oap/server/storage/plugin/influxdb/base/RecordDAO.java#L53

This is really not a good example to refer. I am talking with @dmsolr to get this out.

I have confirmed this is a bug in InfluxDB storage implementation. I have asked @dmsolr to adjust codes to fix this.
So, what is the case of BanyanDB actually?

As I mentioned, the data point id is a combination of metadata, entity_id, and timestamp. If an instance sends several segments in one millisecond, the last one that reaches banyandb will win, and each previous data point is dropped. 

>  I have asked @dmsolr to adjust codes to fix this.

I would like to know how to fix this. banyandb could get benefits from the same solution. @dmsolr Would you please elaborate it a bit in this thread?
I have discussed this with @wu-sheng, and will be working on it.
@lujiajing1126 I will add a new annotation and attributed in storage model to define the global indices, such as trace id in trace and log, `segment id + span id`(you may miss before) in log.

> @lujiajing1126 I will add a new annotation and attributed in storage model to define the global indices, such as trace id in trace and log, `segment id + span id`(you may miss before) in log.

Also, could you please add index type annotation to indicate which type of index should be used. For numeric type, we have two kinds of indexes,

1. TREE, (for range search)
2. INVERTED
I can, are these types available for global index or just general index(tag)?

> I can, are these types available for global index or just general index(tag)?

I suppose it's OK to support simply general indexes, since currently we only have one global index, i.e. `TraceID` (String + inverted index).

One type, yes. But not just trace id, read https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/8845#issuecomment-1094453157

We need to add a virtual column for segment + span id, named as global_span_id. You will need them in trace and log correlation search

- Also in the same case 👆 when I manually upload the `~/.m2/repository` folder and download it to my local machine, those `9.1.0-SNAPSHOT` files are there. https://github.com/apache/skywalking/actions/runs/2146307624 see the artifacts `maven-cache`

This PR is just an attempt after I've run out of all my ideas 🤦🏻‍♂️
same happen in my condition  8.8.1 server and agent  springcloud gateway 2.3.12

> I am not talking about this PR, I want to make this to make Kafka fetchers work better.

The configuration in kafka-fetcher works on multiple topics. I don't have any special configuration for individual topics online, but there is a configuration enableTopics (not in this PR) to control whether a topic is enabled, and the other is my online The characteristics of the modified kafka-fetcher, the link becomes OAP->MQ->OAP, the purpose is to reduce the configuration of kafka on the agent side, and put the control of kafka on the platform side

@dmsolr Could you take a step in involved in this? I feel like @chenhaipeng seems to misunderstand my point.

To @dmsolr @chenhaipeng, I don't want simply change this fetcher in this way, I want the consumer could be better organized. Could we have a discussion here about this?
@ysy1418899560 Hello, thank you for reporting the potential bug! I will be looking into this and try reproduce the problem.
@ysy1418899560 Can you confirm that bare django without uwsgi works fine on your side? I just did a quick test without uwsgi and it is fine.

It can collects info level log without uwsgi on my side，but the generated trace id is different between on log interface and tracking interface。Trace id is '8074295ba1f11eca9c6f8281960ba1c' on tracking interfacee，but on log interface is 
'ec28b995ba1f11ec91def8281960ba1c'。Pages cannot jump to each other。

Thanks for the update, I'll be looking into this issue.

@mikhail-dr  Thanks to @dongzl 's https://github.com/apache/skywalking-eyes/pull/97 and my https://github.com/apache/skywalking-eyes/pull/100 , now you can configure the comment style like this 👇 to use DocString style

```yaml

header: # `header` section is configurations for source codes license header.
  # ... other configurations
  language:
    Python:
      extensions:
        - ".py"
      comment_style_id: PythonDocStringStyle

```

@ysy1418899560  Hello, I think I kinda know the cause, it is not quite related to SkyWalking agent, rather it is a behaviour when uwsgi causes the spawned workers to somehow "lose" logging handler abilities - that is a log record emitted in a uwsgi worker is entirely ignored (not even passed to the base handler).  The behaviour is different from that of using logging without uwsgi.

The workaround is simply set in your postfork function for now.
`logging.basicConfig(level='INFO')
`

I will need to understand the thing further to ~~make a proper enhancement~~.
Thanks for you，l will try this method。Please help to solve another issues that the trace id is inconsistency without uwsgi。Pages cannot jump to each other by trace id。

> Thanks for you，l will try this method。Please help to solve another issues that the trace id is inconsistency without uwsgi。Pages cannot jump to each other by trace id。

I will also look into this one. 

BTW I just took another look at the level issue. And I realized that setting your logger to INFO level is a proper way not just a workaround, because you need to first let the logging.logger.handler receive the logRecord before it can be intercepted (this is how logging library is written). 

The reason why it is acting differently inside uwsgi is that the particular logger in Django core code is disabled for some reason (performance I suppose), then nothing at the INFO level shows up anymore. In bare django settings, it will output much more INFO level logs (server logs) like here. So if you need these INFO level logs collected, you need to find a way to reenable the Django loggers, but this is not related to SkyWalking anymore.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26076517/162923317-34b0525b-d89e-4c99-ac98-b06f02855fa5.png)


TLDR, the proper way to deal with this is to make your logger level at least the same as the level you set in agent so that it can be intercepted.
Todo for me: enhance document on the reporter level config.
